title: China’s commercial launch firms get space station cargo boost
summary: China’s human spaceflight agency says the country’s commercial rocket companies could launch low-cost cargo missions in the future.

title: NASA emphasizes need for mission authorization
summary: Ongoing development of a regulatory framework for overseeing new commercial space activity is critical to NASA’s long-term exploration plans that will rely increasing on the private sector, the agency’s deputy administrator said.

title: Daily Telescope: A closer look at the most-distant object visible to the naked eye
summary: Looking far away to understand our own home.

title: U.S. and Chinese officials meet to discuss space safety
summary: American and Chinese officials met recently to discuss space situational awareness (SSA) data, part of broader efforts by the U.S. to better understand emerging national SSA systems.

title: UK Space Agency Signs Agreement with Axiom Space
summary:
The UK Space Agency has signed an agreement with Axiom Space to pave the way for a commercially sponsored astronaut mission. According to a 25 October press release, “UK astronauts” (suggesting more than one astronaut) would spend two weeks in orbit carrying out scientific research, demonstrating new technologies, and participating in educational outreach activities. “The […]
The post UK Space Agency Signs Agreement with Axiom Space appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ULA sets Christmas Eve launch date for first Vulcan Centaur
summary: LAS VEGAS — United Launch Alliance now plans to launch its first Vulcan Centaur rocket on Christmas Eve, carrying a commercial lunar lander. The company announced Oct. 24 that the […]

title: DoD developing strategy to tap commercial space market
summary: the Pentagon's space policy office is crafting a strategy to harness emerging technologies for national security purposes. An area of particular focus is in-space logistics services such as satellite refueling.

title: The Daily Telescope: A quarter Moon over Sicily reflects light from Earth
summary: Come for the Moon, stay to learn about the Black Madonna statue.

title: ITU to consider lunar communications regulations
summary: Discussions at an upcoming major telecommunications conference may set the stage for future work regulating lunar communications.

title: Japanese government grant to support work on new ispace lunar lander
summary: The Japanese government is providing ispace with $80 million to help fund development of a new lunar lander in parallel with a similar effort by the company’s U.S. subsidiary.
